'It's become clear that Harry now regrets some of his actions. He wants to reset his relationship with his family and with the people of the UK', an insider has said. 7.5k comments 2 videos 355 shares Prince Harry has 'regrets' and wants a 'reset' with his family and UK Schoolgirl has a VERY cheeky response after meeting the Princess of Wales The Princess of Wales (pictured) left a group of school girls giggling yesterday as she stopped to chat with them about their school holidays. Kate, 43, visited Marina Mill, in Cuxton, Kent, a British family business that specialises in hand-designing and screen-printing furnishing fabrics on Thursday. The fabric makers supply dozens of royal homes - from Buckingham Palace to Clarence House to Highgrove, and even the Prince and Princess of Wales themselves - and are world- renowned for the quality of their fabrics, as well as the fact that they still do everything by hand. After a joyous afternoon, the Princess stepped outside where she was greeted by a gaggle of smiling school girls. 161 comments 1 video 73 shares Heartwarming moment Kate Middleton shares cheeky conversation with... 'They can't be trusted!': Royal expert on how Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are 'b news' for the monarchy 741 comments 1 video 105 shares Royal expert on how Prince Harry is 'b news' for the monarchy EXCLUSIVE King Charles' designer friend BANS nepo babies from his London Fashion Week show after saying he's 'inundated with requests' from 'influencers who are just interested in fame for fame's sake' When London Fashion Week opens next week, there will be the usual glamorous leggy pares, glittering couture and star-studded afterparties. But one design duo is preparing to clamp down on the latest catwalk craze: the flood of nepo babies and influencers elbowing into the spotlight. British label Vin + Omi will stage their show next week, and in a first for any of the fashion capitals - New York, London, Milan and Paris - will ban celebrity offspring and social-media stars outright, refusing them entry to the runway, the guest list and the coveted front row. 63 comments 11 shares King's designer friend BANS nepo babies from London Fashion Week show How Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton have me Princess Diana's Jewellery their own after Duchess spotted wearing it on Netflix 172 comments 10 shares Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton have me Diana's jewellery their own Back to top Home Showbiz TV News Femail Sports Health Science Royals Money Real Estate Media U.K. Video Buyline Sitemap Archive Video Archive Authors Topics Index RSS Text-based site Reer Prints Top of page Daily Mail Metro Newzit Published by Associated Newspapers Ltd DMG Media Contact us How to complain Leership Team vertise with us Contributors Work with Us Terms Do not sell or share my personal information CA Privacy Notice About Daily Mail Privacy policy & cookies

<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15139873/churchill-madly-love-queen.html">
      
      It was little wonder that in March 1955, after Churchill had informed her of his decision to finally retire, Queen Elizabeth was keen on granting the old bulldog nothing less than a Dukedom. There was just one problem: a Palace decision had been taken never to create another non-royal Dukedom. And Palace officials refused to budge on the matter, even for Churchill.

</h2>

<a href="/news/royals/article-15140803/Hogwarts-Express-William-Kate-three-children-katie-hind.html">
      
      When the Hogwarts Express pulls up in your back garden, it would be rather rude for one not to hop aboard. So when Hogsmeade Station was built on Windsor Great Park, which his just a stone's throw from Prince William and Kate Middleton 's new home, Forest Lodge, the couple ensured that their three children pop along to the set to watch the filming of the forthcoming Harry Potter television series. On Friday night Kate took Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis for a spellbinding visit where they met the cast which includes Dominic McLaughlin, 11, who is portraying young wizard Harry, and watched some scenes be recorded in what would have been a magical evening for the young royals who are huge fans of the movies.

<span class="is-paywalled"></span>

</h2>
<a href="/news/royals/article-15099451/prince-andrew-nickname-diplomats-andrew-lownie.html">
<img alt="Revealed: The scathing nickname diplomats coined for Prince Andrew thanks to his 'childish" height="355" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/28/09/102247747-0-image-m-1_1759049722666.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>
</a>
<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15099451/prince-andrew-nickname-diplomats-andrew-lownie.html">
      
      The nickname was coined during the Duke of York's trips to the Middle East while he was Special Representative for International Trade and Investment for the UK Government.Writing in his unauthorised biography about the Duke of York, Entitled, author Andrew Lownie recalls the events of a trip to Bahrain on one of his first trips as a special representative which left a lasting impression on the foreign service. He wrote: 'Accompanied by his equerry Robert Olney, assistant private secretary Stephen Harrison, two protection officers, lady clerk and valet, he spent two days in Bahrain, working closely with the ambassador, Peter Ford, and his deputy Simon Wilson. Top of the agenda for the visit was the sale of British-made Hawk aircraft, but to everyone's astonishment Andrew ignored his official brief and suggested to the king, Sheikh Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa, that it made better financial sense to lease them.'
    </a>

</h2>
<a href="/tvshowbiz/article-15138259/EDEN-CONFIDENTIAL-Princess-Beatrice-bound-grandfather-Prince-Philips-favourite-charity-served-patron-65-years-mother-Fergies-leaked-email-scandal.html">

<a href="/tvshowbiz/article-15138259/EDEN-CONFIDENTIAL-Princess-Beatrice-bound-grandfather-Prince-Philips-favourite-charity-served-patron-65-years-mother-Fergies-leaked-email-scandal.html">
      
      EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Over the past six years they've weathered the sort of storms that would have left other families fractured and riven with recrimination. But such are the intense, if unconventional, bonds between the Duke of York, his former wife Sarah (right) and their two daughters, Princesses Beatrice (left) and Eugenie, that their support for each other seems to grow ever stronger. It is, I'm sure, a pattern which will endure even now, in the aftermath of the latest - and arguably most distressing - revelation to date: the publication of an email Fergie wrote in 2011 and sent to Jeffrey Epstein , who'd been released from prison for sex offences two years earlier.

<meta content="16" itemprop="position"/>
<h2 class="linkro-darkred">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15137485/Sarah-Ferguson-sells-Belgravia-townhouse.html" itemprop="url">

Sarah Ferguson sells her £4.2million Belgravia townhouse - and funds 'may keep her and Prince Andrew in the Royal Lodge in Windsor'</a>
</h2>
<a href="/news/royals/article-15137485/Sarah-Ferguson-sells-Belgravia-townhouse.html">
<img alt="Sarah Ferguson sells her £4.2million Belgravia townhouse - and funds 'may keep her and" height="250" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/27/08/102481785-0-image-m-5_1758959512039.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>
</a>
<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15137485/Sarah-Ferguson-sells-Belgravia-townhouse.html">
      
      Sarah Ferguson has sold her £4.2million London townhouse just three years after purchasing it as an investment property. The Duchess of York had been renting out the two-bedroom property in Belgravia to a private tenant for an estimated £4,000 a week in recent months. Sarah bought the property in June 2022 in her own name, but her daughters Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie were also listed on Land Registry paperwork. New documents show a pending application for its sale after a deal was struck over the summer, although it is not clear how much the 65-year-old Duchess has made. The funds to purchase the Georgian property are said to have come from money inherited by Beatrice and Eugenie from the Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip.
    </a>

<div class="article article-large cleared" data-original-title="How Sarah Ferguson made and squandered millions in eclectic money-making schemes in her never-ending bid to live like royalty" data-track-module="royals-desktop-ap-single_width_big_pic" itemprop="itemListElement" itemscope="" itemtype="//schema.org/ListItem">
<meta content="17" itemprop="position"/>
<h2 class="linkro-darkred">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15136773/Sarah-Ferguson-money-making-schemes.html" itemprop="url">

How Sarah Ferguson made and squandered millions in eclectic money-making schemes in her never-ending bid to live like royalty</a>
</h2>
<a href="/news/royals/article-15136773/Sarah-Ferguson-money-making-schemes.html">
<img alt="How Sarah Ferguson made and squandered millions in eclectic money-making schemes in her" height="287" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/27/08/102476249-0-image-m-10_1758959588481.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>
</a>
<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15136773/Sarah-Ferguson-money-making-schemes.html">
      
      From writing children's books to promoting cranberry juice, Sarah Ferguson has spent decades working on money-making schemes to bring in some much-needed cash. The Duchess of York, also known for hosting reality shows and interviewing stars for money, has often found herself on the verge of bankruptcy despite her royal status. She has been on an insatiable quest for cash through a series of business ventures since divorcing Prince Andrew in 1996, despite being left with £3million at the time. This included £1.4million to set up a trust fund for Beatrice and Eugenie, £500,000 from the Queen to buy a new house for her and her children and £350,000 in cash. While Sarah got a modest monthly allowance based on Andrew's salary as a Royal Navy officer, she also had a £4.2million overdraft at royal bankers Coutts & Co. The Daily Mail has taken a look at her efforts to boost her finances over the years after charities dropped her on Monday following the disclosure of a bombshell email to paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein which described him as a 'supreme friend'.
    </a>

</h2>
<a href="/news/article-15135861/Sarah-Ferguson-stripped-royal-title-Virginia-Giuffre-Jeffrey-Epstein.html">
<img alt="Sarah Ferguson should be stripped of her royal title says Virginia Giuffre's family after" height="408" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/26/11/102470963-0-image-m-4_1758882368628.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>

<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/news/article-15135861/Sarah-Ferguson-stripped-royal-title-Virginia-Giuffre-Jeffrey-Epstein.html">
      
      The family of Virginia Giuffre have demanded that Sarah Ferguson be stripped of her royal title over her connection to convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. In an interview with BBC Newsnight, Giuffre's brother and sister-in-law spoke out after an email emerged in which the Duchess of York apologised to Epstein and referred to him as a 'supreme friend' - even though he had already been convicted of sex crimes. The Duchess 'humbly apologised' to the convicted sex offender for letting him down and said she had been told to speak out if she wanted to save her career as a children's author.

</h2>
<a href="/femail/article-15119267/Meghan-Markle-Edward-Enninful-Vogue-Charles-Camilla.html">
<img alt="Meghan Markle is brushed off by Edward Enninful's new magazine - but former Vogue editor" height="370" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/21/19/69821095-0-image-m-3_1758480071102.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>

<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/femail/article-15119267/Meghan-Markle-Edward-Enninful-Vogue-Charles-Camilla.html">
      
      Edward Enninful (pictured left), the former editor of British Vogue, has bluntly dismissed the possibility that onetime friend Meghan Markle (pictured right) might appear on the pages of his new magazine. The 53-year-old, whose new creative project EE72 launched with a celebrity-studded party in London on Friday night, worked alongside the Duchess of Sussex, 44, when she guest-edited the September 2019 issue of Vogue. But, while the edition championing inspiration women and titled 'Forces for Change', became the fastest-selling issue in the publication's 104-year history, Edward has indicated that he has no plans to collaborate with Prince Harry's wife again. 'Meghan and I had a great moment with the issue we did, but I feel like I have done it and I wouldn't necessarily repeat myself,' Edward told The Times.

      The year 1992 was a notoriously bad year for the Royal Family publicity-wise. Princess Anne divorced her first husband, Mark Phillips, part of Windsor Castle burned down and both Prince Andrew and the then Prince Charles announced their separation from their respective wives. But the most cringeworthy incident in the year that the late Queen described as her annus horribilis was when the Duchess of York - just months after her separation -  was photographed in the newspapers in a very compromising position.       Summer may be behind us, but with shorter days and cooler temperatures come golden leaves, spiced lattes and - best of all - a fresh new wardrobe. This season is all about cosy layering, with rich fabrics, buttery leather, soft suede and timeless knitwear taking centre stage. And of course, no autumn collection would be complete without the return of a perennial favourite: tartan. <meta content="82" itemprop="position"/>
<h2 class="linkro-darkred">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15115093/Prince-Harry-Joss-Stone-educating-children-UK.html" itemprop="url">

Prince Harry asked pal Joss Stone about her move from America back to Britain in another nod to Duke's 'plan to educate Archie and Lilibet in the UK'</a>
</h2>
<a href="/news/royals/article-15115093/Prince-Harry-Joss-Stone-educating-children-UK.html">
<img alt="Prince Harry asked pal Joss Stone about her move from America back to Britain in another" height="441" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/20/09/102094479-0-image-m-9_1758356680608.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>
</a>
<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15115093/Prince-Harry-Joss-Stone-educating-children-UK.html">
      
      Prince Harry asked Joss Stone about moving from America back to Britain - praising UK schools and 'how important community is for children', the singer has revealed. The Duke of Sussex chatted with the star during the WellChild Awards at the Royal Lancaster Hotel in London on September 8 during his four-day trip to the UK. Stone said Harry asked about her family's recent transition back to life in the UK after living in the US, where he has been residing with Meghan Markle since 2020. She told Hello!: 'He also asked about how we were settling back in and was genuinely interested in our move home. He's just very warm and down to earth, as always. Maybe Harry will move back too. That would be nice. He was saying how wonderful the schools are here and how important community is for children. It was nice to share that with him because it's exactly why we felt drawn to come back - for the kids to grow up surrounded by family, friends and a strong sense of belonging and most importantly in a safe environment.'
    </a>

<a href="/news/royals/article-15103081/Kate-Middleton-power-fashion-charity.html">
      
      When it comes to royal fashion, Kate Middleton has an immense level of influence. The so-called 'Kate' effect means that items worn by the princess regularly sell out and increase demand for vintage designs. Since joining the Royal Family, the Princess has used this influence to attract attention to British designers. As the saying goes: 'If the world is watching what you wear, make it say something.' Speaking on the Channel 5 documentary Kate: Judge My Work, Not My Clothes, fashion director Bethan Holt said: 'Royals have always used fashion to boost their own profile and to boost the profile of the causes they want to support.

<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/femail/article-15114209/Prince-Andrew-spotted-time-frosty-exchange-Prince-William-Duchess-Kents-funeral.html">
      
      The 65-year-old (pictured) was seen leaving his home Royal Lodge in a Range Rover on Friday morning: it's thought he was en route to Windsor Great Park to go horse riding. It comes after reports that the Duke of York was visibly shunned by members of the Royal family following the funeral this week, with a body language expert describing an exchange between Andrew and his nephew Prince William as 'visibly frosty'. The disgraced Duke of York tried to engage in conversation with his nephew after the pair paid tribute to Katharine Kent in a service at Westminster Cathedral. Andrew could be seen muttering a few words to William, who appeared to decline to engage in the conversation and only gave a brief nod in response.

<h2 class="linkro-darkred">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15107077/kate-middleton-burgundy-coat-perfect-autumn-statement-budget.html" itemprop="url">

Kate Middleton's burgundy coat is the perfect autumn statement - here's where to shop the look on a budget</a>
</h2>
<a href="/news/royals/article-15107077/kate-middleton-burgundy-coat-perfect-autumn-statement-budget.html">
<img alt="Kate Middleton's statement burgundy coat is very on trend for autumn - we've found her" height="417" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/17/16/102216059-0-image-m-3_1758122347775.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>
</a>
<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15107077/kate-middleton-burgundy-coat-perfect-autumn-statement-budget.html">
      
      One colour that is trending right now is undoubtedly burgundy. The rich, autumnal hue is everywhere, from high street to high-end brands, adorning knitwear, corduroy trousers and outerwear alike. A royal fan of the shade is none other than the Princess of Wales, who has been spotted in numerous coats in this coveted colour. She embraced the trend head-to-toe when she and the Royal Family welcomed President Donald Trump and the First Lady to Windsor. Kate wore a new Emilia Wickstead coat, teamed with a Jane Taylor veiled hat and Gianvito Rossi suede court shoes.
    </a>
<div class="article-icon-links-container" data-followbutton="MailOnline">

<a href="/news/royals/article-15025871/im-royal-fashion-expert-kate-middleton-love-m-s-new-collection.html">
      
      M&S has gone from strength to strength in recent years, and I would go as far as to say this autumn's collection might just be its best yet. Every time I step into the High Street Kensington store, I'm tempted - and it seems I'm not alone. Fellow writers and editors all agree the latest drop is irresistible. This season, the offering feels particularly strong: dresses, skirts, trousers, jumpers, and coats - every piece is undeniably lust-worthy. It's no wonder the Princess of Wales is a long-time fan of the British brand, famously owning that tailored blush pink trouser suit.

<h2 class="linkro-darkred">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15083931/How-Sarah-Ferguson-betrayed-Princess-Diana-trust.html" itemprop="url">
<span class="is-paywalled"></span>
How Sarah Ferguson 'betrayed Princess Diana's trust' and they never spoke again, according to royal author</a>
</h2>
<a href="/news/royals/article-15083931/How-Sarah-Ferguson-betrayed-Princess-Diana-trust.html">
<img alt="How Sarah Ferguson 'betrayed Princess Diana's trust' and they never spoke again, according" height="298" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/18/08/102086185-0-image-m-5_1758180122967.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>
</a>
<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/news/royals/article-15083931/How-Sarah-Ferguson-betrayed-Princess-Diana-trust.html">
      
      Princess Diana and Sarah, Duchess of York, were once close friends, sharing regular lunch dates and were dubbed the Merry Wives of Windsor by the press. Even before entering the Royal Fold, they ran in the same social circles and met as children as their mothers went to school together. Diana's former butler, Paul Burrell, wrote in his latest book, Royal Insider: 'Fergie formed a friendship with Diana, Princess of Wales, from the beginning of 1982. They would discuss the dour men in grey suits within the Royal Household, nicknamed the enemy within. Diana, having been in the Royal Family for five years, was able to offer Sarah some sage advice on the dos and don'ts, whom she could trust and a rather lengthy list of those with whom she should be cautious.'
    </a>

The fabric makers supply dozens of royal homes - from Buckingham Palace to Clarence House to Highgrove, and even the Prince and Princess of Wales themselves - and are world- renowned for the quality of their fabrics, as well as the fact that they still do everything by hand. <span class="is-exclusive">EXCLUSIVE</span>

</h2>
<a href="/femail/article-15091219/King-Charles-designer-friend-BANS-nepo-babies-London-Fashion-Week-saying-hes-inundated-requests-influencers-just-interested-fame-fames-sake.html">
<img alt="King Charles' designer friend BANS nepo babies from his London Fashion Week show after" height="284" loading="lazy" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2025/09/12/11/102075373-0-image-m-35_1757672952234.jpg" style="max-width:100%" width="308"/>

<div class="articletext-holder">
<a href="/femail/article-15091219/King-Charles-designer-friend-BANS-nepo-babies-London-Fashion-Week-saying-hes-inundated-requests-influencers-just-interested-fame-fames-sake.html">
      
      When London Fashion Week opens next week, there will be the usual glamorous leggy parades, glittering couture and star-studded afterparties. But one design duo is preparing to clamp down on the latest catwalk craze: the flood of nepo babies and influencers elbowing into the spotlight. British label Vin + Omi will stage their show next week, and in a first for any of the fashion capitals - New York, London, Milan and Paris - will ban celebrity offspring and social-media stars outright, refusing them entry to the runway, the guest list and the coveted front row.
